intro: Palafoxia hookeriana var. minor, commonly known as Hooker's palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
